data.title: Stanley Matthews, Signed
data.meta_description: Stanley Matthews' Football Album by Matthews, Stanley and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Paper-covered Board. Condition: Good. No Jacket. 96pp., illustrated paper-covered boards with red cloth spine. No date, circa 1949. Colour illustration of Stanley Matthews on front in England kit, and rear has badges of England teams. Illustrated in colour illustrations and bw. Frontispiece colour illustration of Stanley Matthews and Stanley Mortenson - the picture of S. Matthews has been signed by him in blue ink across the white shorts. Extremities bumped and worn, edge-wear to board edges, boards rubbed and rather marked. Previous owners name inside ffep, a few grubby marks to page edges, clean internally. Signed by Author(s).

Paper. Condition: Very Good. First Edition. An Original Hand Written and Signed Page by Footballer Sir Stanley Matthews. Undated but C1960. Sir Stanley Matthews 1915- 2000 was an English footballer who played as an outside right. Often regarded as one of the greatest players of the British game and one of the greatest players of all time, he is the only player to have been knighted while still playing football, as well as being the first winner of both the European Footballer of the Year and the Football Writers' Association Footballer of the Year awards. His nicknames included "The Wizard of the Dribble" and "The Magician" Size is 130mm x 82mm. Condition is good. More images can be taken upon request. Ref18067. Signed by Author(s).

No Binding. Condition: Collectible-Very Good. One page letter, 10.5 x 8.5", in which Matthews thanks the Monsignore for sending him a copy of his book "Catholic" which was published in 1884. "I bought this when it first appeared, and have always considered it a most valuable treatise." He had given away the original and is very pleased to have it again. Capel (1837-1911) was the author of a number of books and articles on the Catholic religion. Signed by Author(s).

Covers his stellar career with Stoke City and England and his controversial move to Blackpool. 8vo. [viii] + 256pp. Frontispiece, 14 pages of photographs. Dust-wrapper, very good. Signed to title-page by Alan Ball and Matt Le Tissier (don't ask us why) and there is a very nice blank card signed by Matthews corner-mounted to front pastedown.
